title: 112_hr6621
content: Technical corrections are made to various sections of the Leahy-Smith America Invents Act, including advice of counsel, transitional program for covered business method patents, joinder of parties, and dead zones in inter partes review and reissue of patents. Technical corrections are made to various sections of the Leahy-Smith America Invents Act, including reissue of patents, correcting inventor information, and filing requirements for patent applicants. Technical corrections are made to various sections of the Leahy-Smith America Invents Act, including reissue of patents, correcting inventor information, filing requirements for patent applicants, travel expenses, payment of administrative judges, and patent term adjustments. The amendments made by section 21 of the Leahy-Smith America Invents Act shall be effective as of September 16, 2011. The amendments to the Leahy-Smith America Invents Act include changes to patent application procedures, issuance of patents, and remedies for applicant requests. Section 373 of title 35, United States Code, regarding improper applicants, is repealed. Financial Management Clarifications in title 35, United States Code are amended to adjust administrative cost shares. Derivation Proceedings under section 135(a) of title 35 are modified for patent applicants. Financial Management Clarifications in title 35, United States Code are amended to adjust administrative cost shares. Derivation Proceedings under section 135(a) of title 35 are modified for patent applicants, allowing them to file a petition to institute a derivation proceeding in the Office if they believe their invention was derived from another individual's application without authorization. The Director may institute a derivation proceeding if the petition meets the standards. The amendment in title 35, United States Code allows patent applicants to file a petition for a derivation proceeding if they believe their invention was derived from another individual's application without authorization. The Director may institute a derivation proceeding if the petition meets the standards, and any appeal on this determination is final and not appealable. The amendment in title 35, United States Code allows patent applicants to file a petition for a derivation proceeding if they believe their invention was derived from another individual's application without authorization. The Patent Trial and Appeal Board may be deemed to be the Board of Patent Appeals and Interferences for interference proceedings. The amendment also impacts the Patent and Trademark Public Advisory Committees. The amendment in title 35, United States Code allows patent applicants to file a petition for a derivation proceeding if they believe their invention was derived from another individual's application without authorization. The Patent Trial and Appeal Board may be deemed to be the Board of Patent Appeals and Interferences for interference proceedings. The amendment also impacts the Patent and Trademark Public Advisory Committees by specifying the appointment process and roles within the committees. The Secretary of Commerce has discretion to determine the effective date of amendments related to Advisory Committees under title 35, United States Code. Existing members' terms may be terminated to implement the amendments, regardless of their original end date. The amendments made by this Act, including the termination of existing members' terms, will take effect on the date of enactment and apply to proceedings starting on or after that date. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
